name: Vector3Value
type: class
memorycategory: Instances
summary: |
  A container object for a single Vector3 value.
description: |
  A Vector3Value simply holds a Vector3 as a value. This value can be used for
  scripts to communicate, for objects to move to a preset location, etc.
codesamples:
  - Teleporter-Part
  - Storing-Vector2-inside-Vector3Value
inherits:
  - ValueBase
descendants: []

    description: |
      The stored Datatype.Vector3.
    codesamples: []

    tags: []

    security:
      read: None
      write: None
    threadsafety: ReadSafe

      cansave: true

methods: []
events:
  - name: Vector3Value.Changed
    summary: |
      Fired whenever Class.Vector3Value.Value is changed.
    description: |
      Fired whenever the Class.Vector3Value.Value of the Class.Vector3Value
      is changed. It will run with the new value being stored in the argument
      object, instead of a string representing the property being changed.

      This event, like other changed events, can be used to track when an
      Vector3Value changes and to track the different values that it may change
      to.

      For instance, this may be useful in games that rely on Vector3Values to
      track positions in the game world.

      Equivalent changed events exist for similar objects, such as
      Class.NumberValue and Class.StringValue, depending on what object type
      best suits the need.
    codesamples:
      - how-to-use-vector3value-changed
    parameters:
      - name: value
        type: Vector3
        default:
        summary: |
          The new value after the change.
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
    security: None
    capabilities: []
  - name: Vector3Value.changed
    summary: ''
    description: ''
    codesamples: []
    parameters:
      - name: value
        type: Vector3
        default:
        summary: ''
    tags:
      - Deprecated
    deprecationmessage: |
      This deprecated event is a variant of Class.Vector3Value.Changed which
      should be used instead.
